result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% of prison funds.  Any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated. Order received and filed.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Samantha S.
Alcohol and drug asessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome A Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerome A Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  State has complied with victim notification.   Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by:  Raquel Edgeston.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 7 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Samantha S.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerome A Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Lucy Kronforst for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerome A Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Defense counsel requests new Projected guilty plea/sentencing date.  Case adjourned for Projected guilty plea/sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerome A Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-23-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome A Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Hanna Kolberg for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/21/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Jerome A Smith in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  Defendant Jerome A Smith in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
